en.p1.1: Environmental Protection Policies in Different Countries 游깵游
en.p1.2: Mexico: It has the General Law of Ecological Balance and Environmental Protection (LGEEPA). Institutions like SEMARNAT and PROFEPA oversee and enforce environmental policies. The use of renewable energy and the control of pollutant emissions are being promoted.
en.p1.3: Germany: It is a leader in clean energy and sustainability. It has a plan called Energiewende, which aims to eliminate nuclear energy use and rely more on renewable sources. Its legislation is strict with industry and promotes intensive recycling.
en.p1.4: Brazil: It has laws such as the Forest Code, which regulates land use and protects forests. It faces challenges with deforestation in the Amazon. Despite policies, implementation has been inconsistent due to political and economic conflicts.
en.p1.5: Sweden: One of the greenest countries. It promotes the circular economy and imposes high carbon taxes. It has significantly reduced emissions without harming its economy.
